In essence, any distinct technological upgrade that isn't absurd (i.e. which might replicate the effects of high level powers) and is technologically feasible in some far- fiung future. can be purchased one-at-a-time via this option, and may be integrated into your suit accordingly. This option may also be used to purchase utilities not directly attached to your suit. such as laser— weapons, jetpacks. gauss launchers. and so on. If you are adding supertech to a Cybersuit. this cost is lowered to 8 R.P.

objects.title: Working Stiff
objects.text: You are established enough to either receive significant compensation or to regularly acquire enough funds to have a reasonable standard of living without an ulterior occupation. You won’t require a part-time job, alternative skillset, or otherwise in order to maintain a basic lifestyle, as some Supers are forced to while they’re starting their career

objects.title: Inherited Money
objects.text: You are exceptionally wealthy, and possibly the CEO of a large company, the beneficiary of an enormous inheritance, or a skillful investor. You have several million dollars in savings, and a six-figure passive income to boot. With the assets at your disposal, you could feasibly spend every day in suit and money would never be an object in all but the most absurd purchases.

objects.title: Old Money
objects.text: : You are mind-blowingly wealthy, among some of the richest men on the planet. You have hundreds of millions or even billions of dollars at your disposal, and an eight-figure passive income. You could spend millions of dollars a year and still have a net positive at the end of the year. With intelligent investments and planning, you could create massive corporations, shape political outcomes, or commission incredible technology for your disposal.

objects.title: Villain Money
objects.text: You are boldly one of if not the wealthiest individual on earth. You have several trillion dollars at your disposal, and have a twelve-figure passive income. How you came into such wealth is anyone’s guess, but now your only consideration is what to do with it all: dispense private islands as party favors, purchase million-dollar mansions in every nation on earth, commission a veritable army to your defense, or purchase small countries for convenience if you forget your passport.

objects.title: Domestic
objects.text: : Your base of operations, wherever you may choose to place it, is roughly as large as a suburban home, and may have trouble housing large teams or henchman populations. You have access to technologies Incorporated into this base that a domestic homeowner might: basic security, electricity and water, air conditioning, and so forth.

objects.title: Compound
objects.text: Your headquarters is the size of a large housing or office complex, taking up roughly a full city block in square footage. You could feasibly house large numbers of people under your employ, or use the extra space to create complex training apparatuses and comfort facilities, such as living areas, et cetera. Your base may incorporate any technologies available to our modern military, such as surveillance systems, supercomputers, and landing strips.

objects.title: Station
objects.text: Your base is now roughly the size of an average military base, massive prison compound, university campus, or the like. A base of this size could house immense numbers of people, or have enough space for high-impact supers to flex their abilities without endangering the surrounding area, or facilitate massive weapons systems and laboratories. Your base can incorporate highly futuristic, but not absurd, technological marvels, such as laser-tracking turrets, gravity-training chambers, off-grid nuclear power systems, and more.

objects.title: Citadel
objects.text: Your base may be utterly enormous, spanning dozens or even hundreds of square miles, with every foot painstakingly filled with subterranean operations and sky-scraping megalithic structures. You could feasibly maintain biodomes to house alien life, test weapons of mass destruction safely, or have an entire national park perfectly populated and maintained to your liking in your backyard. Mind boggling feats of supertech engineering may be incorporated into your base, from teleportation pads for quick traversal to hardlight training chambers to antimatter power systems. Your base is nothing short of the eighth wonder of the world.

objects.title: Urban/Rural Construction
objects.text: Your base is located in an urban center or in the continental countryside. Depending on what your objectives are, this may be an ideal position or a hamper on your aims; if you want to quickly help those in need from atop your ivory tower, this may be a perfect position, while those wishing to test strange experimental technology or see how far their powers can go might find this location restrictive.

objects.title: Subterranean Stronghold
objects.text: Your base is under the ground or the sea, located in some abstract cave system, aquifer, or artificially excavated space, for optimal secrecy and subtlety. While you can’t give tours, the main portion of your base is completely hidden from all but the most investigative

objects.title: Oceanic Sanctuary
objects.text: Your base is an artificial construction set in the ocean or within a large body of water. This may include buoyant anchored structures, breathable structures built beneath the surface of the waves, or other airtight architecture designed to withstand the pressures of the water above. Whatever the case, you will have the benefit of privacy at the price of proximity.

objects.title: Island
objects.text: Your base is located on an unclaimed landmass, whose location, biosphere, and climate conditions you may customize. Here, you are free from all but stringent international laws, and have plenty of space to do what you see fit. Attacking you while in your own territory would be a fool s errand. The overall square-footage of this island will be an exponential factor of the size of your base; while a Compound might have a small uninhabited sector outside their own base, a Station might have ten times its own square footage in expandable lands, and a Citadel might constitute its own small state.

objects.title: Mobile
objects.text: Your base has the capacity for locomotion within Earth’s atmosphere, whether by air, land or sea; you may have a retro-fitted cruise liner designed for your pleasure and comfort, or an airborne fortress held aloft by high-output propulsors, or a veritable castle on wheels designed to roll through terrain like a tank. This gives your base immense leverage in location, and could feasibly station itself at a hotspot of activity for any duration, and then move once conflict arises elsewhere.

objects.title: Spacecraft
objects.text: Your base may now exist in the vacuum of space, and may even very well be a fully functioning spacecraft capable of exploring the cosmos. In whatever case, your craft may likely also traverse air and sea in exploration, or may simply hover above the earth, a tower in which to escape the tribulations of the world.

objects.title: Extradimensional
objects.text: Your base is now primarily accessible through extradimensional methods, and exists in a pocket space inaccessible by any other means. You may choose how this place is accessed yourself. In creating a base that is extradimensional in origin, you effectively insulate yourself from literally any interference from the outside world, giving you a pure and free sanctuary. This kind of base is also perfect for concealed operations; who could ever bust you when you're an incalculable distance away while performing your suspect experiments or honing your powers to absurd degrees?

objects.title: Celestial Body
objects.text: Your base is planted firmly within a small, private celestial body, such as an asteroid or pseudo-moon, or even an alternate planet altogether. Within this space, you have total freedom to terraform the surrounding area, mine for precious minerals, create biodomes to house life, or test truly world-crushing powers without any risk to the planet Earth.

objects.title: Form a Team
objects.text: You are the formative member of a team of Supers. You may decide on a name, location, and goals for your team. You may admit anyone you choose who seeks a nomination on your team through the “Join a Team” option. Teams are, unless you should specify otherwise, subject to a set of Default Clauses:  *You (the founding member of the team) can admit or remove anyone from your own team in a compatible Multiplayer bracket. You can also forbid certain individuals from joining the team, change the team's recruitment type, name, and so on as you see fit. *Unless you otherwise specify, a blatant betrayal of the team’s members will remove that individual and prevent them from rejoining. *You can create any sub-organizations within the team that you want: split your members into mentor-sidekick duos, or two teams with separate leaders, or any other structure you can think of. They will all fall under the umbrella of this team. *You can give and take from anyone on your team all the privileges you have as the team’s leader. You cannot be removed from your own team, and only you can disband the team. *Anyone in your team can leave with impunity whenever they see fit. *Your choice of Multiplayer bracket affects who can and cannot join your team. For instance, if you have chosen Listing-Strict for your bracket type, only individuals of your own listing may join your team, and so on. Recruitment: *Open team: By choosing this option, anyone who would like to join your prospective team if they know it exists and are of a compatible Multiplayer bracket. You can still do things like assign members to sub-teams, remove and invite members, pass on administrative privileges, and so on, but initial recruitments are automatic unless you should say otherwise. ★Conditional team: Choose some set of conditions (such as a requirement that they have some option(s) within this CYOA, that they accept some terms you set, that they have a certain type of power, etc.) For those who meet the conditions you describe, your team is as if it were an open invitation. Those who do not meet the conditions you describe may be allowed to join if you permit them. If you enter your team under the auspices of a met condition and then fail to meet that condition, you will be automatically excised from the team. ★Closed team: Prospective members must receive your permission to join your team. This may involve assessments of their capabilities, alignment, and potential, as well as the utility their powers and resources might bring to the table.

objects.title: Join a Team
objects.text: This option grants +1 R.P. for joining a team, unless you are joining a team that you yourself made within a different build of this CYOA, or you are joining a team in which one of your builds is already a current member. In such a case, it costs 10 R.P. This is to prevent absurdly powerful teams from forming around one another, and disincentivize the creation of builds whose sole purpose is to distribute powers and enhancements to a “main” build. If another person has chosen the "Form a Team" option, you may join that team depending on what recruitment type they have chosen: Any team with the "Open Team" parameter can be joined instantly, if the team’s leader has a compatible Multiplayer bracket type. Any team with the "Conditional Team" parameter should specify some set of conditions you must meet. If you meet those conditions, the team can be joined instantly if the team’s leader has a compatible Multiplayer bracket type. Any team with the "Closed Team" parameter requires a recruitment from it's founding member, and you should seek admission from them to join if the team’s leader has a compatible Multiplayer bracket type. (to get 4 points go negative)

objects.title: Mooks
objects.text: You have between one and two dozen unpowered (without superhuman abilities) individuals under your hire or otherwise compelled to your service. Their human skillsets are up to your discretion, as well as your reasons for hiring them, et cetera, so long as they do not possess superhuman abilities. If you have Utilities, Supertech, or Suits, you may distribute these to them.

objects.title: Mercenaries
objects.text: You have less than or equal to a hundred unpowered men and/or women under your command, for whatever purposes you may deem necessary. Their skill sets are up to your discretion, and may be far more extravagant and selective, from acrobats to former secret agents to aircraft pilots.

objects.title: Honor Guard
objects.text: You have several hundred individuals whose desires and motivations align with yours, who are self-motivated to loyalty and who follow you like a cult leader. They may serve as a personal militia, a staff for an enormous base or complex, a full staff of researchers and advisors, or simply as your servile following. Their skills may range within any bounds achievable by the human mind and body, so long as there are enough people of that specification on Earth.

objects.title: Small Army
objects.text: (May be purchased multiple times) You have anywhere between one thousand and ten thousand individuals at your disposal, and you may choose any number you deem appropriate within this range. At this point, your followers might constitute a fully fledged military force, an entire company of your employees, a nation-spanning cult in your name, or otherwise. For each purchase of this option beyond your initial one, multiply your original number (between one thousand and ten thousand) by five.

objects.title: Low-Level
objects.text: A low-Listing Super has either taken up your cause or sought your dollar, your charisma, or your approval. Using this CYOA, you may create this Super under your wing. When you make this Super’s build, skip the “Your Listing” section. You will have 8 points and 10 Resource Points to build the Super who will serve under you.

objects.title: Mid-Level
objects.text: A mid-Listing Super has been influenced by your philosophy, your reputation, your money, or your charisma and become willing to serve under you or to otherwise benefit your ends. Using this CYOA, you may create this Super. When you make this Super’s build, skip the "Your Listing” section. You will have 10 points and 10 Resource Points to build the Super who will serve under you.

objects.title: High-Level
objects.text: A high-Listing Super sees you as their personal idol, their only hope, or their best possible beneficiary, and is willing to do what you require of them for your approval, payment, or merely to be connected with you. Using this CYOA, you may create this Super. When you make this Super’s build, skip the “Your Listing” section. You will have 12 points and 10 Resource Points to build the Super who will serve under you.

objects.title: The Strongest Alive
objects.text: The title of world’s strongest Super is the most coveted position on Earth, bar none. Unsurprisingly, the title shifts rapidly; at times it has been held by high-level bloodline Supers such as the Matriarch of the Voss family, or the progenitor of the Oath bloodline in the late 50’s. It has just as often been held by absurdly powerful rising heroes and villains, who come into the limelight only briefly before a fatal error costs them the position, and often their life. It’s about time it changed hands in your favor.

objects.title: The World
objects.text: Unsurprisingly, Supers tend to be ambitious, for good or ill. Perhaps your motivation to change the world is good; you want to eliminate wars, or protect those who can’t protect themselves. More than likely, however, is that you’d like to change the world for personal reasons rather than moral ones. To sit on a throne above endless peons, to take mankind into the stars and conquer existence, to make slaves of mortal men: these are often the motivations of those who would change the planetary status quo. In any case, the world is awaiting its master or its savior.

objects.title: Your Prerogative
objects.text: Most Supers, heroic or villainous, have lofty, complex objectives in mind: the conquest of the universe, the protection of humankind, the exploration of the cosmos, and the like. Perhaps these are what you have in mind, but perhaps you have objectives more subtle than the average bear. Power, vengeance, or simply living a quiet life with those you love may all be your prerogative, or perhaps something else which none but you could ever think to pursue with the abilities and resources at your disposal. You are free to do as you will with the powers at your hand and the responsibilities that come with it.

objects.title: Your Rivals
objects.text: As with any endeavor, you’re certain to meet competition, challenge, and opposition. You may freely create as many rivals by means of this CYOA as you see fit, so long as they can’t benefit you. Moreover, you can even declare rival groups if you are a formative member of one. These sorts of relationships may, in classic superhero fashion, range from outright murderous contempt to competition between equals to more subtle, on-and-off rivalry when the situation suits it. Every hero has his rogues gallery, every villain his entourage of adversarial do-gooders and competitors. This option may be restricted by your choice of Multiplayer options.

objects.title: The Titans
objects.text: The Titans represent the most pressing and continual threat to the existence of mankind on Earth, and without the benefit of superhuman protectors have wiped innumerable parallel Earths clean of sentient life. They are rising powers among Morphic Entities, capitalizing on the same extinction event which made so many powers available to mankind. Why they target human life with such ruthless intensity is beyond anything more than speculation; some believe they are actively malicious, while others believe they simply wish to flex their powers against others, and quite conveniently a troupe of worthy opponents arrives upon them when they threaten millions of innocent people. Though there are numerous weaker Titans, the great triumvirate of the current era consists of Hydra, the Titan of electromagnetism, Typhon, the Titan of the nuclear Strong Force, and Golem, the Titan of gravitation. Gaea, the Titan of the nuclear Weak Force, is the only known Titan to have been permanently defeated by the legendary hero Pegasus of the Oath bloodline. It is almost certain that a still-stronger replacement, if not an entirely new trifecta, will arise to replace them.

objects.title: The Egregores
objects.text: The mass-death of four out of seven Egregores created the world of superhumans, but another event like it is unlikely for billions of years, if ever. A weakness cultivated by the triad for uncountable eons allowed the stalemate to, at last, end, leaving only three remaining contenders to compete for mastery over existence. The idea of defeating all three of them, much less one, is laughable by brute force; each one possesses potentially centillions of powers, many of which are nigh-omnipotent in scale, all of which have been cultivated by billions of years of growth unmatchable by even the most ideally mutated humans. Still, there are more cunning ways to outplay even the omniscient; creating a new Egregore, or inciting a world-shattering conflict between any two and one unfortunate enough to be perceived as weak, and even changing the concepts which the Egregores themselves represent may be viable, if nearly-impossible, paths to victory. A plan which may take thousands or even millions of years to unfold may be required to overcome them and save the planet, though if anyone were capable of such a thing, it would be you.

objects.title: Lineage
objects.text: Whether you are a member of an established family of Supers, or seek to create your own, a certain degree of cunning is required to navigate the strictures of courtship and marital bonds between bloodlines. Veritable wars are fought for the hands of young men and women with incredible powers, and depending on what side of that coin you’re on, you may either be forced to pursue such individuals for your own line’s sake, or be pursued with feverish and often excessive pressure yourself. That said, the results speak for themselves: a lineage of demigods may follow in your footsteps, praised saviors of man, woman, and child, or the most feared villains to ever walk the Earth, and with such power at your right hand comes immense leverage in the world of politics, the affairs of superhumans, and the eye of the public.

objects.title: Fame and Fortune
objects.text: Supers Increasingly occupy the public eye and the world's concentration of wealth; it is difficult if not impossible for unpowered inventors to compete with superhuman engineers, or for celebrities to compete for attention against comic-bookishly beautiful men and women whose daily life is more exciting than any silver screen could replicate. If a Super seeks lordly wealth or the adoration of millions, it’s simply a matter of competition for popularity against other powered individuals. Marketing teams feverishly follow these sorts, making subtle costume alterations and recommending grueling exercise and diet to keep one’s figure perfect for the sake of the opposite sex. Moreover, stockholders flock with ease around rising superhuman minds, investment in whom is almost a guaranteed boon, waiting hand and foot for new technological designs to produce, psychic predictions to act on in market speculation, and so on. All you’d have to do is indulge these individuals, and all that glitters awaits.

objects.title: Worthy Challenge
objects.text: When you are at the top of your game by a wide margin, crushing peons effortlessly beneath your boot can become distressingly boring. Supers seem to be getting weaker over the generations, or perhaps constant comparison to their legendary progenitors gives that effect. Regardless, it is unlikely that truly worthy opponents will last forever on this Earth. You seek something more sustainable: perhaps you scour alternate timelines and extradimensional Earths for the veritable El Dorado of powerful superhuman populations in the dark corners of existence, where they, like burnished gold, are most readily found. With such a drive to compete, it is unlikely you’ll ever go long without a worthy challenger to flex your powers against

objects.title: Endless Escapades
objects.text: The adventure is, to you, an aim in and of itself. The rush of combat, of intrigue, of victory against all odds, and of unimaginable new voyages is a greater motivation than the objectives that lead you there. With every climactic battle and hard-won victory, you can rest assured a still-greater climax awaits in your story. Clashes in power aren’t the only element of a truly great story: love, mystery, terror, and revelation are all the hallmarks of a legendary tale whose tapestry you will spin by the hour.

objects.title: A League of Greats
objects.text: It is seldom that individual Supers become single handedly influential on the entire planet; it is far more common that a group of likeminded Supers, propelled by a collective goal to change the world for the better or to hold it in their hands makes grave and shocking change, for better or for worse. Such groups are remembered in the time-honored halls of the Greats, enshrined in eternal memory like the greek heroes of old, or held in fear like their gods. With a careful selection, your own team could sit among this legendary pantheon, and alter the course of history with the powers at your disposal.

objects.title: The Cosmos
objects.text: Man has not discovered extraterrestrial life other than archetypal Morphic Entities. This doesn’t mean, however, that there is nothing more resting in the pearly stars above, merely that we have not yet tread far enough into the onyx oceans of the universe. In that expanse, countless alien races further than the reach of light itself await, isolated just as we are presently, likely with the capacity for powers like our own, technological marvels, and strange, unthinkable cultures and biologies. You have the potential to lead man there, or to travel therein as our representative yourself, or to protect us from dark, alien abominations who view our species not with curiosity but with malice. The universe awaits its first surveyor in you.

objects.title: Singleplayer
objects.text: The powers and character you have created are the only ones created using this CYOA within the setting, unless you should allow otherwise. For reference, the most powerful Super to ever live within the setting had powers of a Magnitude of 15, with the world’s greatest modern heroes being between Magnitude 10 and 13. If others have made builds of this CYOA which you wish to interact with and both of you have chosen a Singleplayer session, you may occupy the same setting if they also wish to occupy the same setting as your build. This allows you to form teams with an exceedingly select compatible few, if necessary, in which case you may ignore all clauses related to Multiplayer bracket requirements as specified in the Join and Form a Team sections.

objects.title: Multiplayer
objects.text: The powers and character you have created do not exist in a vacuum; there will be other Supers, including other characters created using this CYOA. Alliances, teams, organizations, and rivalries will form as heroes and villains settle into their respective places. While there is little in the way of formal rules, some general principles apply in the Super community as unwritten rules: the avoidance of unnecessary casualties among the uninvolved or those who pose no serious threat, the nondisclosure of secret identities, et cetera. You may break these, since they are informal, but should expect reasonable opposition. Multiple separate sessions may exist, meaning you may or may not be in the same setting as one or more builds made by others, but any you have a formal relationship with (such as being on the same team, declaration of rivalry) will be in your same setting. Builds of this CYOA made without following the basic rules and principles of the CYOA (i.e. points, rules of Aberrants, etc) cannot choose this option.  You may choose any of these three bracket types: Listing-Strict: Only builds of your own listing will come into conflict with you or serve as your allies. While you may feasibly exist in the same setting as builds above or below you, they will either never pose a serious hazard to your goals and never serve to aid you in the pursuit of your goals more than by incident. Members of your session and general causality will be selected for such circumstances to arise. Listing-Loose: Builds one listing above your own, one listing below your own, or at your own listing may come into conflict with you or serve as your allies. While you may feasibly exist in the same setting as builds above or below this threshold, they will either never pose a serious hazard to your goals and never serve to aid you in the pursuit of your goals more than by incident. Members of your session and general causality will be selected for such circumstances to arise. Listing-Open: Any build of any listing may come into conflict with you, so long as they have chosen a compatible multiplayer bracket. Since others will likely choose Listing-Strict and Listing-Loose in some number, the majority of conflicts you engage with will be at or around your own Listing, with the still-present possibility of meeting those drastically more or less powerful than yourself. No interaction is restricted in anyway between yourself and others.

objects.title: Antiquated Mechanics
objects.text: You may take up to three companions or rivals from Power Creator: Classic and/or Power Creator: New Pantheon, and join up to two groups from the same, if you did not create a team or join one.

objects.title: MetaPhysics
objects.text: If another CYOA which is thematically similar does not offer sufficiently customizable powers, freely use this CYOA to create powers for use within that CYOA. If another setting with similar themes (such as Marvel, DC, Worm, Image, etc.) is more desirable, you may place your character within this setting instead.

objects.title: Author
objects.text: If you create any independent writing, backstory, build, or other projects related to this CYOA and make it readily available for others to read.

objects.title: Thanks for Playing
objects.text: If you provide any beneficial feedback related to this or other CYOAs I have created, such as finding grammatical or mechanical errors or stating likes and potential improvements I could make,

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
